thread.title: Ford to Move Current Small Car Production Outside U.S.
thread.title_full: Ford to Move Current Small Car Production Outside U.S.

title: Ford to Move Current Small Car Production Outside U.S.
text:
Ford to Move Current Small Car Production Outside U.S. Auto maker’s move come as strong dollar, stiff competition rolling back Detroit’s recent gains By John D. Stoll Updated July 9, 2015 5:39 p.m. ET 
The auto industry’s attempt to build small cars profitably in the U.S. has hit a pothole. 
Ford Motor Co. said a Michigan factory that assembles its small Ford Focus and C-Max wagon will end production of those vehicles in 2018 in a new setback to efforts to create a market for small cars made in the U.S. Production of the two likely will to be moved outside the U.S. 
The move could put pressure on the United Auto Workers union... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
